So let me just highlight briefly three key areas covered by these updated policies beginning first with cellphone use because it has become such a major distraction inside classrooms lately. Our goal here was finding balance between allowing kids access technology they need yet minimizing disruptions caused due to personal calls texts social media browsing etcetera. What we've done then is establish clear guidelines defining appropriate times places devices can be used without compromising learning environments further supported via teacher discretion classroom agreements plus ongoing conversations addressing digital citizenship responsibilities. Next up are modifications made towards making sure every single one of those young people feel welcome respected included regardless race gender identity sexual orientation religion national origin disability status any other characteristic protected under federal state laws regulations. This means updating how clothing choices should align better reflecting individuality self-expression simultaneously avoiding anything deemed disruptive offensive harmful others nearby. Finally there're adjustments being introduced concerning discipline methods moving away punitive measures instead embracing strategies focused restoration healing growth opportunities rather than punishment alone focusing solely upon misbehavior itself. By doing things differently hopefully build stronger relationships trust bonds forming connections ultimately helping them grow develop positively long-term. Thank you very much.
